discussion.author: ztangent
discussion.text: Unfortunately that's already taken by https://github.com/roberthoenig/FirstOrderLogic.jl and I'd prefer to avoid the clash!

discussion.author: nickrobinson251
discussion.text:
>  I'd prefer to avoid the clash!

That package is not registered in the General registry, so there'd be no clash if users were to `] add FirstOrderLogic` (that said, still the potential confusion if users land upon that repo).

discussion.author: ztangent
discussion.text:
Yup, I understand, but `FOL` provides considerably different functionality (it's essentially a Prolog port), and I'd feel bad given that the other package is older and claimed the name first.

I'd prefer a shorter name, so keeping `FOL` would be great, but otherwise I'd also consider `Julog` (Julian Prolog) or `Predicated` (after predicate calculus).

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text: @ztangent `Predicated.jl` seems like a good name to me!

discussion.author: DilumAluthge
discussion.text: @ztangent I'll close this PR, and then you can make a new registration after you have renamed the package to `Predicated.jl`.

discussion.author: ztangent
discussion.text: @DilumAluthge @nickrobinson251 on reflection I personally think `Julog` would a better package name that communicates what this package provides (i.e., Prolog-like functionality in Julia), whereas its unclear what `Predicated` means, it'd be great if we could go with that instead.
